name: Newsroom Mission: Front Page Ethics
description: You're the lead journalist at The Ethics Chronicle! Help write a Pressroom Proof story about a student who took a brave moral stand. Gather facts, write the article, and publish like a pro.

instructions.description: Kick off the newsroom mission to create a Pressroom Proof article.

inputs.headline: Create a punchy headline that sums up the story. Think like a pro editor!
inputs.student_name: Who is the student in the story? Make it sound real!
inputs.moral_issue: What moral or ethical issue did they face? This is your scoop.
inputs.challenges: Why was this issue tough? What did they struggle with?
inputs.student_decision: What did they decide to do? Why was it the moral thing?
inputs.catholic_teachings: Which Catholic Social Teachings guided their choice? Pick one or two!
inputs.conscience: Describe how their conscience helped them make the decision.
inputs.quotes: Add 2–3 quotes to bring the story to life. Imagine what they, friends, or a teacher might say.

output.article: You’ll get a fully written Pressroom Proof article text with headline, byline, lead, subheadings, quotes, and conclusion — styled just like a real broadsheet story.

instructions.description: Every journalist backs up their story — let’s build your source list in APA 7 style.

inputs.sources: List at least 5 sources: title, author, date, publisher or URL. Separate each one with a new line.

output.bibliography: Formatted APA 7 reference list you can drop straight into your article submission.
